page.title: 08Housing
page.content: Old terraces have partly been replaced by council estates.Derelict land has been purchased for development of small private houses.Space for future building is limited.Estates,controlled by Tameside Council are mostly well_maintained.Provision for older people is in bungalows or a sheltered accommodation alternative.The estate at Haughton Green is run by Manchester Council.Three tower blocks dominate the skyline surrounded by semi- detached and terraced units. Established for 20 years the estates co-exists with some of the oldest cottages in the area.The house price range is as follows for july 1985;{ {Â£63,000}buys a large 8 year old,well equipped house on the edge of the green belt.{Â£9,500}buys a small town, terraced house with basic amenities in need of modernisation.
